text: Alexandre Gustave Eiffel (December 15, 1832 â€“ December 27, 1923; , ) was a French structural engineer and architect. He is known for designing the Eiffel Tower. He also designed the armature (supporting framework) for the Statue of Liberty, New York Harbor, United States. == References == Category:1832 births Category:1923 deaths Category:French engineers Category:People from Dijon Category:Civil engineers
